data.text: @charini @Nemtastic1 @JeanRees10 I think it is guilt. They are shut right down and lost in a sea of guilt for killing their child. They can see nothing else. Even other children.

@Nemtastic1 @JeanRees10 Perhaps, but there's independent media. Albeit not as vast and with a somewhat more limited reach, but I would be screaming it out in the streets and anywhere I could if that was my child. I feel for them and their immense heartache, but to allow it to happen to other children?
@JeanRees10 Why does it say life threatening "no" when he died? I don't understand.
@JeanRees10 @graphiccons Regardless of what the narrative wants you to believe, healthy 8-year-olds do not have heart attacks.
@charini @JeanRees10 I think it's less that they are silent than that 99% of the media silences them by refusing to amplify their message.
@JeanRees10 I don't understand... why are all these parents silent? Why? How is it that they remain silent while these crimes against humanity continue?
